ChartClass.name: Ability Check
ChartClass.description: *House Rule*. Base chance to perform activity that utilizes this ability score. Modifiers: +/-20% Moderate difficulty, +/-40% Hard Difficulty, +/-70% Impossible (plus for decending, minus for ascending)

ChartColumn.name: Base Chance Ascending (roll at or below)
Base Chance Decending (roll at or above)

ChartClass.name: AC Modifiers
ChartClass.description: Various mofidiers applied to armor class. * only applies of the target has no dexterity bonus to AC.

ChartClass.name: Armor Encumbrance
ChartClass.description: Encumbrance values for armor types.

ChartClass.name: Armor I
ChartClass.description: * For non-magic armour. Magic armour is un-encumbering, and allows a maximum move rate 30 ft faster than normal (up to 120 ft). Magic shields weigh as much as normal shields of the same type. OSRIC, p.30

ChartClass.name: Armor Rating
ChartClass.description: Armor values for armor. OSRIC, p.30

ChartClass.name: Assassin Matrix
ChartClass.description: Assassin attack progression.

ChartClass.name: Assassin Saves
ChartClass.description: Assassin saving throw chart.

ChartClass.name: Charisma Chart
ChartClass.description: Charisma adjustment chart.

ChartClass.name: Cleric Experience
ChartClass.description: Cleric level progression. * Constitution hp adjustments no longer apply Each level gained thereafter requires 225,000 experience points and grants +2 hit points. OSRIC, p. 10

ChartClass.name: Cover and Concealment
ChartClass.description: Hard cover will increase chances for saving throws as noted. Cover equal to 90% (or better) will also give the target creatures the benefit of no damage whatsoever if the appropriate saving throw is successful.

ChartClass.name: Detect Invisible
ChartClass.description: Note: You may give unintelligent creatures with keen hearing or sense of smell the equivalent of intelligence to reflect detection of invisible creatures. Check each round the creature is exposed to invisibility. Once detected, the invisible creature will be kept track of thereafter, as the detector will be able to note the cause. Any attacks incur the -4 penalty of attacking an invisible opponent, of course, and the invisible creature likewise is entitled to +4 on saving throws.

ChartClass.name: Druid Saves
ChartClass.description: Saving throws for druids.

ChartClass.name: Dwarvish Detections
ChartClass.description: Racial abilities of dwarves to detect underground features.

row.string: Detect the existence of new construction
Detect sliding or shifting rooms or walls

ChartClass.name: Encounter Reaction
ChartClass.description: Reaction is determined by rolling percentile dice, adjusting the score for charisma and applicable loyalty adjustment as if the creature were a henchman of the character speaking, and the modified score of the percentile dice is compared to the table. * Or morale check if appropriate.

ChartClass.name: Encumbrance
ChartClass.description: Encumbrance for characters in GP.

ChartClass.name: Fighter Matrix
ChartClass.description: Fighter to hit AC chart.

ChartClass.name: Fighter Saves
ChartClass.description: Fighter/Monster Saves, OSRIC, p.363. Non-intelligent monsters save at 1/2 HD except for poison/death.

ChartClass.name: Gaze/Eye Attack
ChartClass.description: The chances of someone meeting the gaze of a creature with gaze attacks.

ChartClass.name: Grapple Attack Modifiers
ChartClass.description: Base chance to hit. Multiply attackers armor class by 10, ignoring magical devices (bracers, cloaks, rings, etc.), but adding 1 for each + 1 of magical armor, to find a percentage chance from 100% to 0%. Example plate armor ac3, would be 30%, +1 plate armor would be 31%. Note: The attacker cannot grapple if either or both hands are holding anything.

ChartClass.name: Grapple Result
ChartClass.description: Any hold shown remains in effect from round to round unless the target scores a higher percentage hold. Damage accrues until a hold is broken or until the holder elects to try for a different hold. The target may still inflict damage by lesser hold results shown after the double slashes (//). These might result in both opponents falling to the ground and continuing their grappling there. Note: If the opponent is stunned, a second attack may immediately be made, and the stunned opponent cannot counter for 1 round.

ChartClass.name: Grapple Result Modifiers
ChartClass.description: In each round of grappling combat there will be an attack and a counter. Any existing hold automatically goes first until broken. Once it is determined that a grappling attack succeeds, the percentile dice must be rolled again to find what hold is gained.

ChartClass.name: Monster Attack Matrix
ChartClass.description: Attack matrix used for monsters or creatures. Any + above 3 equals another HD, missiles are -5 at long range, -2 at medium. *DO NOT RENAME OR DELETE THIS CHART*

ChartClass.name: Monster BaB Matrix
ChartClass.description: Monster base attack bonuse. Used if using d20 mode in settings. *DO NOT RENAME OR DELETE THIS CHART*

ChartClass.name: Monster HD to Level
ChartClass.description: Monster HD to Level Chart, OSRIC, p123

ChartClass.name: Monster Saves
ChartClass.description: Saving throws used for monster or creatures. *DO NOT DELETE OR RENAME THIS CHART*

ChartClass.name: Monster THACO Matrix
ChartClass.description: Monster THACOs. Used if using THACO attack in settings. *DO NOT RENAME OR DELETE THIS CHART*

ChartClass.name: Monster XP Value
ChartClass.description: Experience value of monster based on HD, level and abilities.

ChartClass.name: Morale Check
ChartClass.description: Morale Check modifiers, base is 50% +5% per HD with the listed adjustments. OSRIC, p.125

row.string: Per friend killed, surrendered or fled
Own side greatly outnumbered (2-1 or more)
Per foe killed, surrendered or fled

ChartClass.name: Overbear Attack Modifiers
ChartClass.description: Base chance to hit. Multiply attackers armor class by 10, ignoring magical devices (bracers, cloaks, rings, etc.), but adding 1 for each + 1 of magical armor, to find a percentage chance from 100% to 0%. Example plate armor ac3, would be 30%, +1 plate armor would be 31%. Note: The attacker can have either or both hands otherwise employed.

ChartClass.name: Overbear Result Modifiers
ChartClass.description: Once an opponent is overborne, some other form of combat MUST take place.

row.string: target stunned or both feet held

ChartClass.name: Overbear Results
ChartClass.description: Once an opponent is overborne, some other form of combat MUST take place.

row.string: bounce off or avoided, target may try
target knocked to hands and knees
target knocked flat, stunned for 1 round

ChartClass.name: Paladin Saves
ChartClass.description: Paladin saving throw table. OSRIC, p.19

ChartClass.name: Poison, Ingestive
ChartClass.description: * Saving throw at +4, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 80%. ** Saving throw at +3, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 65%. *** Saving throw at +2, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 40%. **** Saving throw at + 1, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 15%.

ChartClass.name: Poison, Insinuative
ChartClass.description: * Saving throw at +4, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 80%. ** Saving throw at +3, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 65%. *** Saving throw at +2, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 40%. **** Saving throw at + 1, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 15%.

ChartClass.name: Pummel Attack Modifier
ChartClass.description: The base score on percentile dice is opponent AC value times 10 to arrive at a percentage chance to hit, i.e. AC 10 = 100%. AC 9 = 90%. all the way to AC ratings of 0 and minus numbers which indicate no chance or a negative chance to score a hit. Magical protections such as rings, bracers, cloaks, etc. do not count as AC, so ignore them.

ChartClass.name: Pummel Results Modifier
ChartClass.description: In each round of weaponless melee, there will be two pummeling attacks, and possibly several blows per attack. The attacker determines if a strike is successful, and then whether or not it does any damage and how much, if any. Percentile dice are rolled, and the score is modified as shown below.

row.string: Target per point of dex over 14
Target wearing leather or padded armor
Target wearing chain, ring, scale or studded mail
Target wearing magical cloak or ring
Target wearing banded, plate or splint mail
Target wearing slightly open faced helmet
Target wearing visored or slitted helmet

ChartClass.name: Ranger Matrix
ChartClass.description: Ranger to hit table, OSRIC, p. 22

ChartClass.name: Ranger Saves
ChartClass.description: Ranger saving throw table, OSRIC, p. 22

ChartClass.name: Spell Recovery
ChartClass.description: Once rested, magic-users must memorize their spells and clerics must pray and meditate. Allow 15 minutes of game time for memorization or prayer for each spell level. Such activity requires a mind rested by a good sleep and nourished by the body

ChartClass.name: Strength Chart
ChartClass.description: Adjustments for high strength scores, OSRIC p 359

ChartColumn.name: Minor tests, e.g. forcing doors (chance on d6)
Major tests, e.g. bending bars and lifting portcullis (chance on d%)

ChartClass.name: Thief Backstab
ChartClass.description: Thieves make their backstab attack at +4 to hit. Do not include bonus from strength or magic weapons when multiplying damage.

ChartClass.name: Thief Matrix
ChartClass.description: Thief to hit table, OSRIC, p.25

ChartClass.name: Thief Saves
ChartClass.description: Saving Throws for thief.

ChartClass.name: Thief Skills
ChartClass.description: Base chance to perform thief abilities for each level.

ChartClass.name: Weapon I
ChartClass.description: * Long-hafted, pointed weapons, such as the spear, lance (when used dismounted), pole arm, or trident, inflict double damage when set to receive a charge and the foe actually charges. The lance inflicts double damage when used by a character riding a charging heavy warhorse or similar animal; if the attacker is mounted on a normal riding or cavalry horse, the damage should be reduced. OSRIC, p. 29
